results.description: Read the 12 takeaways from this weekend's Scottish Premiership action.
results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Celtic beat Motherwell to remain top of the Scottish Premiership going into the international break. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Celtic 2-0 Motherwell

results.description: Odsonne Edouard opens the scoring and Richard Tait adds an own goal as Celtic beat Motherwell to remain top of the Premiership.
results.shortTitle: Celtic defeat Motherwell to stay top
results.title: Celtic 2-0 Motherwell: Champions win to stay top of the Premiership

thumbnail.altText: Odsonne Edouard celebrates opening the scoring at Celtic Park

results.description: Catch up with all the team news and stats for the six games taking place before the international break, and choose your preferred XI.
results.title: Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: BBC Scotland takes a look at what has propelled Motherwell and Stephen Robinson into the spotlight.
results.title: Motherwell: How has Stephen Robinson transformed Fir Park side?

results.description: A late strike from Allan Campbell keeps Motherwell in third place as they beat Livingston at Fir Park. (UK only|)
results.title: Highlights: Motherwell 2-1 Livingston

results.description: Motherwell have not been approached either "informally or formally" by Hearts about manager Stephen Robinson, says chief executive Alan Burrows.
results.shortTitle: No Hearts bid for Motherwell's Robinson
results.title: Stephen Robinson: No Hearts approach for Motherwell boss

results.description: Motherwell manager Stephen Robinson believes his side can still improve but ultimately deserve to be in third position in the Scottish Premiership.
results.shortTitle: Watch: 'Energy & pace' have taken Motherwell third
results.title: Stephen Robinson: Motherwell boss says 'energy & pace' have taken side third

thumbnail.altText: 'Energy and pace have taken us to third'

results.description: Motherwell hold on to third place in the Scottish Premiership with a hard-fought 2-1 victory over Livingston.
results.shortTitle: Motherwell beat Livi to stay third
results.title: Motherwell 2-1 Livingston: Stephen Robinson's side stay third in Premiership

results.description: Chief executive Alan Burrows says Motherwell cannot "rest on their laurels" after becoming virtually debt free and must use it as a catalyst to more success.
results.shortTitle: 'Just the end of the beginning' for Well
results.title: Motherwell virtually debt free - but it's 'just the end of the beginning'

results.description: Motherwell confirm they no longer owe any money to former owners John Boyle and Les Hutchison.
results.shortTitle: Motherwell pay off debts to Boyle and Hutchison
results.title: Motherwell pay off 1.5m debts to former owners

results.description: Devante Cole hits the winner for Motherwell against 10-man Kilmarnock as the Fir Park side move back into third place in the Scottish Premiership.
results.title: Highlights: Motherwell 2-1 Kilmarnock

results.description: Motherwell reclaim third place in the Scottish Premiership from 10-man Kilmarnock after defeating Angelo Alessio's side 2-1.
results.shortTitle: Motherwell move third with win over 10-man Killie
results.title: Motherwell 2-1 Kilmarnock: Hosts defeat 10-man visitors to go third

results.description: Rangers come from behind to beat Motherwell despite James Tavernier's penalty miss. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Rangers 2-1 Motherwell

results.description: Steven Gerrard pleads with Rangers fans to back captain James Tavernier after he misses his third spot-kick of the season in the win over Motherwell.
results.title: Rangers 2-1 Motherwell: 'Lay-off James Tavernier' pleads Steven Gerrard

results.description: Rangers survive a scare at Ibrox to go back level with Scottish Premiership leaders Celtic by coming from behind to beat Motherwell at Ibrox.
results.shortTitle: Rangers come from behind to beat Well
results.title: Rangers 2-1 Motherwell: Hosts come from behind to keep up pace with Celtic
